Posts.Content: GetSparky wrote: I am an identical twin and my sister was just diagnosed with breast cancer on both sides last week.  It's DCIS stage 0 on one side and IDC grade 2 on the other.  They found more than one tumor on each side.  She is only 37 and is being told it's extremely rare to find cancer on both sides, rare to have more than one growth on each side, and even rarer that she is ER- on one side and ER+ on the other.  We are so confused!!!  She is still waiting to get HER2 test results and BRACA test results.  Since she has multiple spots, we aren't sure yet if she is a good candidate for lumpectomy or if a double mastectomy is the way to go.  Any advice would be wonderful.  And what in the world is the treatment when you have one side that's ER+ and one that's ER-?  I think at this point, she really just needs to know there's an end to all this.  If she had to have double mastectomies, radiation, and chemo, when do you see the light at the end of the tunnel?  A couple months?  Longer?  :( Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Sister has ER- on one side and ER+ on the other GetSparky cbm

Posts.Content: GetSparky wrote: My sister was diagnosed 2 weeks ago with breast cancer in both breasts.  She is PR+, HER-, and is ER+ on one side and ER- on the other.  There are 4 tumors and they are all less than 1 cm.  She is scheduled for a BMX in 2 weeks and will have the expanders put in as well.  She doesn't find out about chemo and/or radiation until after the surgery when she finds out about the nodes.  Right now, not a day goes by where she isn't filled with anxiety, fear, sadness, frustration, etc, etc, etc.  So, when does the crying end and the healing begin?  Also, realistically, even if she did need both chemo and radiation, what is the timeframe for all this to end?  I think if she knew she'd be completely finished in x months, she'd feel better.  Right now, she just looks forward to each day being done, but has nothing to look forward to for the next day.  So, surgery + finished reconstruction (she isn't going very big and isn't going to do nipple construction) + chemo + radiation...4 months, 6 months, 8 months, when will breast cancer just be a blip on her radar and not be on the daily schedule?
